text:
<optional title, max 6 words>

<setup: dim room, tension-filled, characters distressed>
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>
Raskolnikov: “Was I a louse or a man?”  

Sonia: “To kill? Have the right to kill?”  

Raskolnikov: “Don’t interrupt! I want to prove…”  

---

<setup: emotional turmoil, Raskolnikov in despair>
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>
Raskolnikov: “I murdered myself, not her!”  

Sonia: “What suffering!”  

Raskolnikov: “Let me be! Enough!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist grapples with the moral implications of his actions, feeling that he has not only killed another but has also destroyed himself in the process.
